com.yantra.api.omp.order

Interface releaseOrder

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface releaseOrder

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document releaseOrder(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The releaseOrder API releases a scheduled order.

    • Method Detail

      • releaseOrder

        org.w3c.dom.Document releaseOrder(YFSEnvironment env,
                                  org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                           throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                  java.rmi.RemoteException

        The releaseOrder API releases a scheduled order.

        A new release is determined by comparing attributes of the OrderLines to the input xml. For a Provided Service (PS) or a Delivery Service (DS) line, releases will not be created.
        The releaseOrder API will backorder any item which has been scheduled to a node but has its inventory picture marked as incorrect.
        The releaseOrder API will split any line that is being partially released. The portion being backordered will be split into a new line. This is controlled by the Split On Backorder of Line With Firm Predefined Node rule and Split On Backorder of Line Without Firm Predefined Node rule based upon if the IsFirmPredefinedNode flag on the order line is set to Y or N respectively. This only applies when the Use Single Node For Line Fulfillment rule is set to Y.

        The on-hand safety factor will be excluded from on-hand inventory availability based on the following logic when the ApplyOnhandSafetyFactor flag on the scheduling rule is set to Y.

        • If OnhandSafetyFactorQuantity or OnhandSafetyFactorPercentage is configured for the item, it will be excluded from the current availability of the item at the node with a node type that has ApplyOnhandSafetyFactor = Y for each requested node, tag, segment type and segment combination. (Note: On-hand safety factor will only be applied to supplies with supply type that has a corresponding record in the YFS_INV_AVAIL_SAFETY_FACTOR table).
        • Otherwise if on-hand supply type has a safety factor percentage configured, it will be excluded from the supplies with that supply type for the item at the node with node type that has ApplyOnhandSafetyFactor = Y for each requested node, tag, segment type and segment combination.

        The future safety factor will be excluded from future inventory availability based on the following logic when the ApplyFutureSafetyFactor flag on the scheduling rule is set to Y.

        • If FutureSafetyFactorPercentage is configured for the item, it will be excluded from the current availability of the item at the node with a node type that has ApplyFutureSafetyFactor = Y for each requested node, tag, segment type and segment combination. (Note: Future safety factor will only be applied to supplies with supply type that has a corresponding record in the YFS_INV_AVAIL_SAFETY_FACTOR table).
        • Otherwise if future supply type has a safety factor percentage configured, it will be excluded from the supplies with that supply type for the item at the node with node type that has ApplyFutureSafetyFactor = Y for each requested node, tag, segment type and segment combination.

        If MinShipByDate is specified on the order line with a time sensitive item, available supply with the ShipByDate earlier than the MinShipByDate will not be considered in the availability of the item.

        Payment Processing With Delayed Reauthorization

        If the Payment Rule on the order supports Delayed Reauthorization, the reauthorization date will be recomputed based on any release date changes made by the API. If the IgnoreReleaseDate flag is passed as Y, an authorization may not be collected before release.

        This is a hold type enabled transaction. If order has a hold type which has releaseOrder as one of the prevented transactions then order can not be released. Error OMP11037: Transaction is prevented when order is on hold type is thrown.

        Global Trade Item Number (GTIN)
        When availability is read across items sharing same GTIN, selling item is replaced with additional item when inventory of additional item is used..


        With Inventory Visibility (IV) integration phase 2 enabled :

        The api will call IV's node availability API to get real time availability and then find the best solution with the obtained availability.
        The api will then attempt to make a short lived reservation for the best solution using IV's reservation API. If the reservation succeeds it indicates that the availability is still intact in IV and the order releasing will proceed. The demands will then be sent asynchronously to IV with the help of an integration server. These demands will have the reservation id which will be consumed by IV.
        If the above reservation fails then the order will back order.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Error XML Error DTD

        If an OrderLine contains values for the following attributes that match values for these attributes on an OrderLine in a currently existing release for the same order, the release is consolidated.

          Attribute in OrderLine If not supplied
          ShipNode
          ReceivingNode
          SCAC from OrderHeader
          CarrierServiceCode from OrderHeader
          CustCarrierAccountNo from OrderHeader
          DeliveryCode
          Fob
          PackListType
          ShipToId
          ShipToKey
          CostCurrency
          ReqShipDate Earliest ReqShipDate from the lines picked up by release
          ReqDeliveryDate Earliest ReqDeliveryDate from the lines picked up by release
          ServiceLineKey Order Line Key of the PS or DS Line
          GiftFlag
          CarrierAccountNo from OrderHeader
          CurrentWorkOrderKey CurrentWorkOrderKey from the lines picked up by release
          PipelineKey PipelineKey from the lines picked up by release
          CostCurrency CostCurrency from the lines picked up by release

        When the order has the DoNotConsolidate flag set to "N", the following attributes will be used for matching if they are set up as buyer/seller constraints and routing based constraints.

          Attribute in OrderLine
          CustomerPONo
          MarkForKey
          OrderType
          DepartmentCode
          ItemClassification of the Item on OrderLine
        In addition to the above, Release Consolidation templates will be used for consolidation purposes. For example, to prevent release consolidation of lines containing items with different Harmonized Codes, select the Harmonized Code attribute in the release consolidation template. Once this has been configured, this api will only consolidate order lines in the same release if the Harmonized Code of the candidate order line matches the Harmonized Code of any order line from the selected release, along with the constraints mentioned above.

        If attribute HasOrderLineOptions of Release Consolidation template is enabled, then order lines can be consolidate only if both the lines have OrderLineOptions or both doesn't have OrderLineOptions.

        Once this setting has been done, releaseOrder api will consolidate order lines in a same release if along with constraints mentioned above, Harmonized Code of candidate order line matches with Harmonized Code of any order line from the selected release.

        User Exits:

          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSCheckOrderBeforeProcessingUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetDeliveryLeadTimeUE

        Events Raised:


          ON_RELEASE_CREATION_OR_CHANGE - Raised once for every release created or modified
          Key Data: modifyRelease_dbd.txt
          Data Published: ON_RELEASE_CREATION_OR_CHANGE

          ON_SUCCESS
          Key Data: modifyOrder_dbd.txt and modifyLine_dbd.txt and modifyRelease_dbd.txt
          Data Published: ON_SUCCESS

          ON_CANCEL - Raised if releaseOrder cancels.
          Key Data: modifyRelease_dbd.txt
          Data Published: ON_CANCEL

          ON_BACKORDER - Raised if releaseOrder backorders.
          Key Data: modifyOrder_dbd.txt
          Data Published: ON_BACKORDER


        INVENTORY_VALUE_CHANGE:
          At the time of release order this event is raised from inventory management module for each released order line with the inventory value change information for the released location.
          Data published - YFS_RELEASE_ORDER.INVENTORY_VALUE_CHANGE
          Key data - YFS_RELEASE_ORDER.INVENTORY_VALUE_CHANGE

        Raised under the transaction CAPACITY_CHANGE

          ON_STD_CAPACITY_FILLED:
            Raised when consumption exceeds standard capacity defined for the day.
            Data Published: INV_CAPACITY_CHANGE.ON_STD_CAPACITY_FILLED.html
            Template Support: Yes
            Configuration Required for backward compatibility: No

        Raised under the transaction INVENTORY_CHANGE

          INVENTORY_CHANGE.EXTERNAL_DEMAND_CHANGE:
            Raised when there is a demand update.
            Key Data: INVENTORY_CHANGE_EXTERNAL_DEMAND_CHANGE_dbd.txt
            Data Published: INV_INVENTORY_CHANGE.EXTERNAL_DEMAND_CHANGE.html
            Template Support: Yes
          INVENTORY_CHANGE.EXTERNAL_SUPPLY_CHANGE:
            Raised when there is a supply update.
            Key Data: INVENTORY_CHANGE_EXTERNAL_SUPPLY_CHANGE_dbd.txt
            Data Published: INV_INVENTORY_CHANGE.EXTERNAL_SUPPLY_CHANGE.html
            Template Support: Yes
          ON_STD_CAPACITY_FREED:
            Raised when consumption is freed and standard capacity becomes available for the day.
            Data Published: INV_CAPACITY_CHANGE.ON_STD_CAPACITY_FREED.html
            Template Support: Yes
            Configuration Required for backward compatibility: No
          EXTERNAL_CAPACITY_CHANGE:
            This event is raised when capacity consumptions are changed.
            Data published: YFS_CAPACITY_CHANGE.EXTERNAL_CAPACITY_CHANGE.xml
            Template Support: Yes

        Template Support:
        No.
        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility:
        N/A.

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: No

        Database Extensibility Support: No

        Additional Information

        Node Notification
        The earliest date an item can be released is based on the both the maximum notification time (MaxNT) and the advanced notification (AdvanceNT) time defined at the item, classification, or node levels. The NodeNotification that best matches the expected shipment date (ESD) will determine which notification times for the node will be used. The largest between the item and node will be used for notification time. The release date of a line will be the ESD - MaxNT - AdvanceNT. Maximum notification time will be applied to the node's shipping calendar, while advance notification time will not. If there are NodeNotificationSchedules, the previous notification time (based on the schedule) prior to the calculated date will be the earliest date the release will occur.

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by createEnvironment.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.
        Returns:
        null
        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
